children.subject: I would say that the 128 material is pretty self teachable if you have already taken 120 and 16B. 120 and 16B should also be enough for 106B. The best part of 128 imo was getting better at making Latex writeups and using matlab/simulink, which are practical skills you can probably self-learn. The textbook "Control Systems Engineering" by Norman Nise is pretty informative and all of our exercises were pretty much from there, so that would be a good resource.

history.content:
I am for sure taking 126, 106a next semester. I figured I might as well jam a third tech in because its my last year and I am going to be home all day. 

Is 128 absolutely essential for someone who is possibly interested in pursuing robotics? Would self teaching at a later date be a valid option, especially considered courses are going to be online next semester?  I am signed up for it because it makes the most sense, but I am not as interested in taking it as I am in my alternative options (no in person labs also contributes to this....). I have taken 120 and I would like to take 123 next semester and 106b, but the content of 128 doesn't excite me as much, but I also dont know exactly what that course is like.
history.subject: Robotics schedule help
